alert.note: Alert for La Plata (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 04 at 7:45PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Colorado, including the following county, La Plata. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 742 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms in southern La Plata country from Highway 140 south of Breen east through Highway 151 south of Ignacio. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes Colorado Highway 172 from mile marker 0 to 7, Highway 550 from mile marker 0 to 8, and Highway 140 from mile marker 0 to 14. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bondad, Breen, Kline, Marvel and Redmesa.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
